name: accelerative

relating to acceleration (= an increase in something's speed, or its ability to go faster): I was really impressed by the accelerative power of the new model - you wouldn't know it was an electric vehicle. The same accelerative force was applied to each of the bodies in the experiment.
More examplesFewer examplesThe motorbike has fine-tuned accelerative sensitivity when you really need the speed.Although not particularly accelerative or exciting to drive, it is still an impressive vehicle.The battery is used to provide accelerative energy and is charged by regenerative braking.
